subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 3.8.1, JDK 1.4.1 and RedHat 8.0 ->  TextRunnerTest failure
msgSnippet: I barely have Java working on my RedHat 9 box. I haven t tried JUnit yet. :) ... J. B. Rainsberger, President, Diaspar Software Services Let s write software
messageBody:
I barely have Java working on my RedHat 9 box. I haven't tried JUnit yet. :)

>So said Jason Rogers on 2003-05-21 --------------------
>How about being a little more specific. Why could the textui not run
>anything? What's the error? Same for the swingui. About the failed
>test I have no clue. Vladimir? J.B.? Dave?
>
>=jason
>
>On Tue, 2003-05-20 at 22:28, texanworker wrote:
>> Using RedHat 8.0, JUnit 3.8.1, and JDK 1.4.1_01 I tried to
>> run the textui and found
>> that it could not run anything.
>>
>> Using the swingui, I found that I could run some
>> tests, such as
>> junit.samples.money.MoneyTest.
>>
>> However, the standard test,
>> junit.samples.AllTests
>> returned a
>> failure:
>>
>> testSuccess(junit.tests.runner.TextRunnerTest)
>>
>> the specific
>> failure was:
>>
>> junit.framework.AssertionFailedError
>>
>> This is a setback to my
>> testing plans.
>>
>>
>>
>>
